title: Is 'Deck the Halls' a Christmas song? - Quora

response.answer_text: In usage, yes. In reality - well Yuletide is as close as it gets to mentioning anything near Christmas, and Yule is actually a pagan winter holiday, so no. In any event, the majority of the ‘lyrics’ are Fa la la, so make of that what you will. Deck the halls with boughs of hollyFa la la la la, la la la la 'Tis the season to be jollyFa la la la la, la la la la Don we now our gay apparelFa la la la, fa la la la; la la la la la!Troll the ancient Yuletide carolFa la la la la, la la la la… AND, before you ask, it is also not about gays, or trolls. (Unless one of the latter posted this question to begin with?)

Thanks for the a2a first off. Secondly, you xan look at this from two different perspectives. One is yes, it is a traditional Christmas song, and it can be sung for any season you wish to be jolly in. Just by substituting a couple of words it can be sung for any holiday you wish. As it stands it is suited for Christmas and new year's day. The line now we don our gay apparel can mean any holiday you dress up for and decorate the house (Halloween anyone) for. Hope this helps.
response.upvotes: Answer requested by L. Stewart Hearl
